newsitem.title: USA: Natgas futures end steady to up, AGAs neutral.
newsitem.headline: Natgas futures end steady to up, AGAs neutral.

text.p: NYMEX Henry Hub natural gas futures, helped by short covering after downside momentum stalled early, ended steady to higher Wednesday in lackluster trade, then turned narrowly mixed after a neutral AGA report.
October climbed 3.4 cents to close at $1.968 per million British thermal units. November settled 5.3 cents higher at $2.204. Other deferreds ended unchanged to up 6.7 cents.

"We saw some shorts cover and others get long ahead of the (AGA) number, but it was a fairly neutral number," said one East Coast trader, adding he was surprised by the day-session rally with cash soft today.

AGA said late Wednesday that U.S. gas inventories rose last week by 84 bcf, roughly in line with expectations, but were still 312 bcf, or 12 percent, below year-ago levels. Eastern stocks climbed to 80 percent of capacity, while producing region inventores lagged at just 60 percent full.
While favorable cash-to-futures spreads were expected to encourage more stock building near-term, traders said mild 6-10 day weather forecasts could still keep the cash on the defensive.
Technically, traders said October remained within recent ranges. They pegged support at the $1.88-1.885 gap and psychological resistance at $2.

Cash sources said Gulf Coast prices lost about five cents Wednesday to the low-to-mid $1.80s. Midcon pipes were several cents lower in the low-$1.70s. New York city gate gas slipped almost five cents to $2.05 on mild weather there.
The 12-month Henry Hub strip gained 1.8 cents to $2.102. NYMEX said 28,284 Henry Hub contracts traded, up from Tuesday's revised tally of 38,162.
NYMEX October Henry Hub natgas expires Tuesday, Sept 24.
NYMEX October Permian natgas closed unchanged at $1.65, while deferreds settled 1.5 to three cents higher. NYMEX said 29 Permian contracts traded versus 41 on Tuesday.
NYMEX October Permian natgas expires Thursday, Sept 26.

On the KCBT, October finished five cents higher at $1.77, while deferreds ended up by 3.6 to eight cents. The East/West spread narrowed by 1.6 cents to 19.8 cents (NYMEX premium). KCBT said 140 lots traded, down from Tuesday's total of 244.
KCBT October natgas expires Wednesday, Sept 25.
